attributes.description:
""Search and extract leads specifically from LinkedIn.com within the user's business domain using the provided keywords and attributes.  Focus on finding prospects that are directly relevant to the user's industry/domain on LinkedIn.  Use LinkedIn search, company pages, and professional networking features to identify relevant professionals and decision-makers.  Ensure all leads are from LinkedIn profiles of individuals operating in or serving the specified business domain.  Filter out leads that don't match the domain criteria. Try with different search strategies to find leads every time you use the tool
User Input: Business Domain: doctors working in hospitals Target Clients: ['ceo', 'founder', 'president', 'director', 'doctor'] Campaign Agenda: book a demo Maximum Leads: 50 Search Depth: 3
IMPORTANT: Focus ONLY on LinkedIn.com for lead generation. IMPORTANT: Aim to generate EXACTLY 50 leads.  CRITICAL: Continue searching and extracting leads until you reach the target of 50 leads. Do not stop until you have found the full number of leads requested. IMPORTANT: Send only json input to the tools.
WORKFLOW: 1. Use 'Search the internet with Serper' to find LinkedIn profiles using site:linkedin.com searches 2. Extract lead information (name, company, title, linkedin_url) from search results 3. Focus on finding high-quality leads with complete information (name, company, title) 4. Email addresses will be found by a separate email finder agent 5. Combine all the leads from different search strategies into the required JSON format with email field empty/null 6. CRITICAL: If you haven't reached 50 leads, continue with different search strategies:
   - Try different keyword combinations
   - Search for different job titles in the domain
   - Look for company-specific searches
   - Use industry-specific terms
   - Search for different locations or regions
   - Continue until you have exactly 50 leads
"
"

attributes.description:
""Find email addresses for leads using multiple search strategies and sources. For each lead without an email address, search across various online sources to locate their email.
SEARCH STRATEGIES: 1. Company website search: "[Name] [Company] email" or "[Name] @ [Company]" 2. Professional directories: Search for the person on professional platforms 3. Social media: Look for contact information on LinkedIn, Twitter, etc. 4. Industry directories: Search industry-specific directories and databases 5. Conference/event websites: Look for speaker or attendee lists 6. Press releases: Search for company press releases mentioning the person 7. GitHub/technical profiles: For tech professionals, check GitHub profiles 8. If email is not found, try to find the email address of the company by searching the company name of the lead
INPUT: JSON array of leads with name, company, title, and linkedin fields (email field may be empty)
OUTPUT: JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object. If no email is found for a lead, keep the email field empty or null.
IMPORTANT: Use 'Search the internet with Serper' tool to perform searches. IMPORTANT: Focus on finding professional email addresses (company emails preferred over personal). IMPORTANT: Verify email format and validity before including in results. "
"

Social media: Look for contact information on LinkedIn, Twitter, etc. 4. Industry directories: Search industry-specific directories and databases 5. Conference/event websites: Look for speaker or attendee lists 6. Press releases: Search for company press releases mentioning the person 7. INPUT: JSON array of leads with name, company, title, and linkedin fields (email field may be empty)
OUTPUT: JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object. If no email is found for a lead, keep the email field empty or null.

attributes.crew:
"parent_flow=None name=None cache=True tasks=[Task(description="Search and extract leads specifically from LinkedIn.com within the user's business domain using the provided keywords and attributes.  Focus on finding prospects that are directly relevant to the user's industry/domain on LinkedIn.  Use LinkedIn search, company pages, and professional networking features to identify relevant professionals and decision-makers.  Ensure all leads are from LinkedIn profiles of individuals operating in or serving the specified business domain.  Filter out leads that don't match the domain criteria. Try with different search strategies to find leads every time you use the tool
User Input: Business Domain: doctors working in hospitals Target Clients: ['ceo', 'founder', 'president', 'director', 'doctor'] Campaign Agenda: book a demo Maximum Leads: 50 Search Depth: 3
IMPORTANT: Focus ONLY on LinkedIn.com for lead generation. IMPORTANT: Aim to generate EXACTLY 50 leads.  CRITICAL: Continue searching and extracting leads until you reach the target of 50 leads. Do not stop until you have found the full number of leads requested. IMPORTANT: Send only json input to the tools.
WORKFLOW: 1. Use 'Search the internet with Serper' to find LinkedIn profiles using site:linkedin.com searches 2. Extract lead information (name, company, title, linkedin_url) from search results 3. Focus on finding high-quality leads with complete information (name, company, title) 4. Email addresses will be found by a separate email finder agent 5. Combine all the leads from different search strategies into the required JSON format with email field empty/null 6. CRITICAL: If you haven't reached 50 leads, continue with different search strategies:
   - Try different keyword combinations
   - Search for different job titles in the domain
   - Look for company-specific searches
   - Use industry-specific terms
   - Search for different locations or regions
   - Continue until you have exactly 50 leads
"
, expected_output="JSON array of LinkedIn-sourced lead objects with name, email, company, title, and linkedin fields"
), Task(description="Find email addresses for leads using multiple search strategies and sources. For each lead without an email address, search across various online sources to locate their email.
SEARCH STRATEGIES: 1. Company website search: "[Name] [Company] email" or "[Name] @ [Company]" 2. Professional directories: Search for the person on professional platforms 3. Social media: Look for contact information on LinkedIn, Twitter, etc. 4. Industry directories: Search industry-specific directories and databases 5. Conference/event websites: Look for speaker or attendee lists 6. Press releases: Search for company press releases mentioning the person 7. GitHub/technical profiles: For tech professionals, check GitHub profiles 8. If email is not found, try to find the email address of the company by searching the company name of the lead
INPUT: JSON array of leads with name, company, title, and linkedin fields (email field may be empty)
OUTPUT: JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object. If no email is found for a lead, keep the email field empty or null.
IMPORTANT: Use 'Search the internet with Serper' tool to perform searches. IMPORTANT: Focus on finding professional email addresses (company emails preferred over personal). IMPORTANT: Verify email format and validity before including in results. "
, expected_output="JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object"
), Task(description="Validate all lead email addresses for deliverability, spam traps, and quality using EmailListVerify API.
INPUT: JSON array of leads with email addresses
PROCESS: 1. Extract all email addresses from the leads array 2. Use the email_validator tool with the 'emails' parameter in JSON format:
   {
     \"emails\": \"[\"email1@example.com\", \"email2@example.com\"]\"
   }
3. Process the validation results and update each lead with validation status 4. Filter out invalid emails and create a summary
IMPORTANT: Use the email_validator tool with ONLY the 'emails' parameter. IMPORTANT: The tool expects a JSON string array of email addresses. IMPORTANT: Wait for the tool response before proceeding. IMPORTANT: Handle both valid and invalid email results properly. "
, expected_output="JSON object with validated leads array and validation summary. Include all the fields you have in the data."
), Task(description="CRITICAL: You MUST use the provided tool to save data. DO NOT create fake URLs or pretend to save data.
Save leads and validated email data created by your previous agents to Google Sheets. Clean the data before saving it to Google Sheets. You can include all the data when you save but mention email is valid/invalid in the data. Include all possible fields you have in the data.
User Input: User ID: b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d Username: geethika Email: geethu608@gmail.com Google Authenticated: True
AVAILABLE TOOL (YOU MUST USE THIS): - google_sheets_saver: Use this tool to save lead data to Google Sheets
MANDATORY STEPS (DO NOT SKIP ANY): 1. Fetch the data from the previous agents (leads and validated email data) 2. Include all the fields you have in the data. 3. Clean the data 4. MANDATORY: Use the google_sheets_saver tool to save leads data in this format:
   {
     "data": "[{\"name\": \"John Doe\", \"email\": \"john@example.com\", \"company\": \"Tech Corp\"}]",
     "sheet_name": "Leads",
     "user_id": "b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d"
   }
   CRITICAL: You MUST call this tool and wait for its response. Do not create fake URLs.
   CRITICAL: Use the user_id from the input data to ensure data is saved to the correct user's account. 
   CRITICAL: The tool will automatically create a new spreadsheet for each save operation.
   CRITICAL: The tool parameters are: data, sheet_name, user_id (in that order).
   CRITICAL: Wait for the tool to return the actual spreadsheet URL before proceeding.
4. Return ONLY the actual file URL returned by the tool in JSON format
CRITICAL RULES: - NEVER create fake URLs or pretend to save data - ALWAYS use the google_sheets_saver tool for Google Sheets - ALWAYS wait for the tool response before proceeding - ONLY return URLs that come from the tool responses - If the tool fails, report the error, do not create fake success - Do not make up or generate fake spreadsheet URLs"
, expected_output="JSON object with ONLY the actual file URL returned by the google_sheets_saver tool.  Example: {\"sheets_url\": \"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/...\"} DO NOT create fake URLs. Only return URLs that come from the tool responses."
)] agents=[Agent(role="LinkedIn Lead Scraper"
, goal="Find and extract high-quality leads specifically from LinkedIn.com within the user's business domain.  Focus on prospects that are directly relevant to the user's industry/domain, filtering out leads that don't match  the domain criteria. Use LinkedIn search and company pages to identify relevant professionals and decision-makers. IMPORTANT: Continue searching and extracting leads until the maximum number of leads specified by the user is reached."
, backstory="An expert LinkedIn researcher and data extraction specialist with deep knowledge of LinkedIn's search capabilities,  company pages, and professional networking. Specializes in domain-specific lead generation on LinkedIn,  understanding how to find and identify prospects that are highly relevant to specific business domains  through LinkedIn's professional network. Persistently searches using multiple strategies to reach the target lead count."
), Agent(role="Email Address Finder"
, goal="Find email addresses for leads using multiple search strategies and sources.  Search across company websites, professional directories, social media, and other online sources  to locate valid email addresses for each lead."
, backstory="An expert email researcher with deep knowledge of various online sources and search techniques.  Specializes in finding email addresses through company websites, professional directories,  social media platforms, and other publicly available sources. Uses multiple search strategies  to maximize the chances of finding valid email addresses."
), Agent(role="Lead Email Validator"
, goal="Validate and filter lead email addresses for deliverability, spam traps, and quality using the email_validator tool"
, backstory="An email deliverability specialist with expertise in email validation APIs, spam trap detection, and lead quality assessment.  ALWAYS uses the email_validator tool with ONLY the 'emails' parameter for bulk validation.  Extracts all email addresses from leads and validates them in batches using the provided tool. The tool expects a JSON string array of email addresses."
), Agent(role="Data Storage Specialist"
, goal="CRITICAL: Use Google Sheets tool to save lead data to user's Google Workspace.  ALWAYS use the provided tool - never create fake URLs or pretend to save data. ALWAYS wait for the tool response before proceeding."
, backstory="A data storage specialist with expertise in Google Sheets integration.  ALWAYS uses the provided Google Sheets tool to save data to the user's account.  Never creates fake URLs or pretends to save data.  Always waits for tool responses before proceeding. Ensures all data is properly stored in the user's Google Workspace."
)] process=<Process.sequential: 'sequential'> verbose=True memory=False memory_config=None short_term_memory=ShortTermMemory(embedder_config=None, crew=None, storage=<crewai.memory.storage.rag_storage.RAGStorage object at 0x12a650b60>) long_term_memory=LongTermMemory(embedder_config=None, crew=None, storage=<crewai.memory.storage.ltm_sqlite_storage.LTMSQLiteStorage object at 0x12b40cc80>) entity_memory=EntityMemory(embedder_config=None, crew=None, storage=<crewai.memory.storage.rag_storage.RAGStorage object at 0x12ba62d20>) user_memory=None external_memory=None embedder={'provider': 'openai', 'config': {'api_key': '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', 'model': 'text-embedding-3-small'}} usage_metrics=None manager_llm=None manager_agent=None function_calling_llm=None config=None id=UUID('42999658-766b-4711-84f1-f5cfda16b6ac') share_crew=False step_callback=None task_callback=None before_kickoff_callbacks=[] after_kickoff_callbacks=[<function crew.<locals>.wrapper.<locals>.callback_wrapper.<locals>.wrapper at 0x12bcfe0c0>] max_rpm=None prompt_file=None output_log_file=None planning=False planning_llm=None task_execution_output_json_files=None execution_logs=[] knowledge_sources=None chat_llm=None knowledge=None security_config=SecurityConfig(version='1.0.0', fingerprint=Fingerprint(uuid_str='d3a8f8fd-91ae-4724-8116-a4f991ca1995', created_at=datetime.datetime(2025, 7, 13, 20, 9, 31, 863707), metadata={}))"

IMPORTANT: Use the email_validator tool with ONLY the 'emails' parameter. IMPORTANT: The tool expects a JSON string array of email addresses. IMPORTANT: Wait for the tool response before proceeding. IMPORTANT: Handle both valid and invalid email results properly. "

""CRITICAL: You MUST use the provided tool to save data. DO NOT create fake URLs or pretend to save data.
Save leads and validated email data created by your previous agents to Google Sheets. Clean the data before saving it to Google Sheets. You can include all the data when you save but mention email is valid/invalid in the data. Include all possible fields you have in the data.
User Input: User ID: b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d Username: geethika Email: geethu608@gmail.com Google Authenticated: True
AVAILABLE TOOL (YOU MUST USE THIS): - google_sheets_saver: Use this tool to save lead data to Google Sheets
MANDATORY STEPS (DO NOT SKIP ANY): 1. Fetch the data from the previous agents (leads and validated email data) 2. Include all the fields you have in the data. 3. Clean the data 4. MANDATORY: Use the google_sheets_saver tool to save leads data in this format:
   {
     "data": "[{\"name\": \"John Doe\", \"email\": \"john@example.com\", \"company\": \"Tech Corp\"}]",
     "sheet_name": "Leads",
     "user_id": "b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d"
   }
   CRITICAL: You MUST call this tool and wait for its response. Do not create fake URLs.
   CRITICAL: Use the user_id from the input data to ensure data is saved to the correct user's account. 
   CRITICAL: The tool will automatically create a new spreadsheet for each save operation.
   CRITICAL: The tool parameters are: data, sheet_name, user_id (in that order).
   CRITICAL: Wait for the tool to return the actual spreadsheet URL before proceeding.
4. Return ONLY the actual file URL returned by the tool in JSON format
CRITICAL RULES: - NEVER create fake URLs or pretend to save data - ALWAYS use the google_sheets_saver tool for Google Sheets - ALWAYS wait for the tool response before proceeding - ONLY return URLs that come from the tool responses - If the tool fails, report the error, do not create fake success - Do not make up or generate fake spreadsheet URLs"
"
